context_bundle.summary: Python command-line interface development with Click, Typer, and argparse for argument parsing, Rich for beautiful terminal output, and best practices for user-friendly CLI tools

onboarding.quick_start: pip install click typer rich && python -c 'import click; import typer; import rich' && typer --version
common_patterns: Click basic: 'import click; @click.command() @click.option("--name", default="World") def hello(name): click.echo(f"Hello {name}")'
Typer with types: 'import typer; app = typer.Typer(); @app.command() def greet(name: str = "World"): print(f"Hello {name}")'
Multiple commands: '@click.group() def cli(): pass; @cli.command() def init(): pass; @cli.command() def deploy(): pass'
Rich console: 'from rich.console import Console; console = Console(); console.print("[bold red]Error![/bold red]")'
Progress bar: 'from rich.progress import track; for item in track(items, description="Processing"): process(item)'
Table output: 'from rich.table import Table; table = Table(); table.add_column("Name"); table.add_row("Alice"); console.print(table)'
Argparse: 'import argparse; parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(); parser.add_argument("--verbose", action="store_true"); args = parser.parse_args()'
Environment variables: '@click.option("--token", envvar="API_TOKEN") def cmd(token): pass' for config from env
known_errors: Command not found: Ensure entry point in pyproject.toml '[project.scripts]' section, reinstall with 'pip install -e .'
Option not recognized: Check option names match function parameters, use '--' for flags, '-' for short options
Type conversion error: Specify type in Click with 'type=click.INT' or Typer with 'name: int'
Rich not rendering: Check terminal supports ANSI colors, use 'console = Console(force_terminal=True)' for pipes
Subcommand not working: Use '@click.group()' for parent command, '@group.command()' for subcommands
Help text not showing: Add docstrings to functions, use 'help=' parameter in options
